conclusion: The problem involves a charged ball suspended by an insulating string in a uniform electric field.
A small ball with charge q is suspended by an insulating string with a length L. The angle between the string and the vertical direction is Î¸.
The ball is in equilibrium under the influence of gravitational force, tension in the string, and electric force.
The forces in the vertical direction are balanced by the gravitational force and the vertical component of the electric force.
The forces in the horizontal direction are balanced by the horizontal component of the gravitational force and the horizontal component of the electric force.
The vertical component of the electric force balances the vertical component of the gravitational force.
The horizontal component of the electric force balances the horizontal component of the gravitational force.
Solving the equations gives the electric field strength E = mg/q.
The electric field strength is E = mg/q.
